text: Justin Langer has scored 23 centuries in international cricket. Justin Langer is a former Australian cricketer. A left-handed opening batsman, he played for Australia between 1993 and 2007 and made 23 centuries in international cricket, all in Tests. he sits joint fifty-sixth in the list of century-makers in international cricket. Langer made his Test debut against the West Indies at the Adelaide Oval, Adelaide on 23 January 1993. He scored his first Test century against Pakistan at the Arbab Niaz Stadium, Peshawar on 15 October 1998, scoring 116. He scored his final Test century against England at The Gabba, Brisbane on 23 November 2006 and his final Test match was the final game of the same series at the Sydney Cricket Ground, Sydney on 2 January 2007, having played 105 matches. His highest score in Tests is 250, scored against England at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, Melbourne on 26 December 2002. Langer made his One Day International (ODI) debut against Sri Lanka at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium, Sharjah on 14 April 1994 and played his final ODI against England at Lord's, London on 25 May 1997, having played 8 matches. He never made a century in the format; his highest score was 36, which he made against India at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium, Sharjah on 19 April 1994. ==Key== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !
